main event: A very bright, reddish light was observed low in the southeastern sky on May 25, 1960, which appeared to be stationary for a few seconds before suddenly disappearing.
interesting points: The light was much brighter than surrounding stars and had a steady appearance with no outlining visible,The observation lasted for varying lengths, with one instance noted for 4 to 5 seconds and another for 10 to 15 minutes,The light seemed to slightly change position when next observed, but was initially perceived as stationary,The report suggested that the movement and sudden disappearance could be explained by atmospheric conditions,At the time of the observation, the planet Jupiter was also visible close to the sighting location.
witness description: A reliable person with a responsible position in local civil defense and their daughter
